form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Duckworth (for herself, Ms. Hirono, Mr. Kaine, Mr. Blumenthal, Mr. Padilla, Ms. Baldwin, Mr. Schatz, Mr. Schiff, Mr. Wyden, Mr. Reed, Mrs. Murray, Mr. Markey, Mr. Sanders, Ms. Klobuchar, Mr. Welch, Ms. Cortez Masto, Mr. Van Hollen, Mr. Booker, Ms. Smith, and Mr. Durbin) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To ensure due process protections of individuals in the United States against unlawful detention based solely on a protected characteristic.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Korematsu-Takai Civil Liberties Protection Act of 2025.
Section 4001 of title 18, United States Code, is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: by redesignating subsection (b) as subsection (c); and
by inserting after subsection (a) the following:

subsection.header: Prohibition on detention based on protected characteristics

paragraph.text: In this subsection, the term protected characteristic includes each of the following:

subparagraph.text: Any additional characteristic that the Attorney General determines to be a protected characteristic.

paragraph.text: No individual may be imprisoned or otherwise detained based solely on an actual or perceived protected characteristic of the individual.
Nothing in this subsection shall be construed to allow the Attorney General to remove a characteristic described in subparagraphs (A) through (H) of paragraph (1).
